SEARCH
Package coding201.code

Class PlayerClub

java.lang.Object
coding201.code.PlayerClub
Direct Known Subclasses:
OpposingTeam
public class PlayerClub extends Object
Player Club This class is responsible for creating the framework for the player club. It contains the complete athleteList, starterList and reserveList as well as the name of the club and the starting balance of the club
Version:
1.0
Author:
tve21, bro82

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayerClub

      public PlayerClub()
      These are constructors used to set up the variables within the PlayerClub class, there are three of them as there are three different calls to the class

    • PlayerClub

      public PlayerClub(int balance, String name)
      These are constructors used to set up the variables within the PlayerClub class, there are three of them as there are three different calls to the class
      Parameters:
      balance - an integer value representing the money the club has
      name - an string value representing the name of the team

    • PlayerClub

      public PlayerClub(int balance, String name, Hashtable<String,Athlete> athleteList2)
      These are constructors used to set up the variables within the PlayerClub class, there are three of them as there are three different calls to the class
      Parameters:
      balance - an integer value representing the money the club has
      name - an string value representing the name of the team
      athleteList2 - a list of athletes

  • Method Details

    • reShuffle

      public void reShuffle()
      This method is called when an event occurs that removes a player from the club's starter list. It moves a player, if in the reserve list, to fill the empty space in the starter list.

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer(Athlete athlete)
      Adds a player to the club's athletelist table and either the starterlist or reservelist depending on how many players are in the starters.
      Parameters:
      athlete - an instance of the Athlete class

    • addBoughtPlayer

      public Athlete addBoughtPlayer(Athlete athlete)
      Adds the bought athlete to the starter list, swaps out the old starter with the new athlete and puts the old starter in reserve
      Parameters:
      athlete - an instance of the Athlete Class
      Returns:
      Athlete

    • getName

      public String getName()
      This method returns the name of the team
      Returns:
      returns the string form of the teamName

    • printAthleteList

      public String printAthleteList()
      Returns a "nicer" version of the athleteLIst hashtable.
      Returns:
      string form of the AthleteList hashtable.

    • getInventory

      public Hashtable<String,PurchaseableItem> getInventory()
      Gets the inventory of the club
      Returns:
      Returns the hashtable of the Club's inventory.

    • addItem

      public void addItem(PurchaseableItem item)
      Adds an item into the club's inventory.
      Parameters:
      item - to be added.

    • removeItem

      public void removeItem(String itemName)
      Removes an item from the inventory by passing the item's name as the key into the hashtable.
      Parameters:
      itemName - a string representation of the name of the item

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      Sets the clubs name as the input name
      Parameters:
      name - a string to set the name of the club to

    • Fill

      public void Fill()
      Fills up the club with 4 random athletes; Only used when club first initialised along with OpposingTeam
